text: (bright music)
- My name is Aaron Khoo.
I work for AWS Backup, the team

and I am head of
engineering for that team.
I've been in AWS for six years.
(bright music)

So the AWS Backup service
was launched January, 2019.
So the service itself is roughly
about four years old at this stage.

It's definitely been quite
a rocket ship of a journey.

We've grown very
significantly year over year.

It's been a very fun ride
for all of us on the team.
I think we have fun while we're working.
(bright music)

Yeah, I enjoy coaching
and growing the team.

I really enjoy working with
the managers who report to me,
the engineers who report to me.

It's just really
interesting to watch people
grow in their careers.

That's really the thing
that motivates me the most.

Much smarter engineers than
me work on the hard stuff now.
But from an operational perspective

as is expected of all
engineering managers at Amazon,
we do of course get our hands dirty there.
(bright music)
Everything that we do here at AWS

it's really hard to replicate
the scale that we have.

We just have so many
customers around the world

and the problems are
so big to go and solve
from a web services point of view,

that it is super challenging
for any engineer.
At any stage in their career,
there are always problems to be solved
up and down the stack.
And you will learn a lot

and you will work with
some of the smartest people
on the planet.
Every day, I find myself astounded

by the thing I learn or
discovering a new service.
Earlier today, I was talking to somebody
who works on quantum computing
and I learned a host of new things
just sitting there, listening to him

describe how his systems
worked, for example.
I know nothing about quantum computing

and this was a tremendous
learning experience for me.
(bright music)
I'm sure all our engineers feel the same
on a day to day basis.
What you're going to find at AWS

is that we trust our
engineers and our employees.

What I have found most
motivating on a day to day basis,
is that we are all owners here.
I own my own career.
I own the opportunities that are here.

So I have been able to
make a lot of decisions

that have impacted
customers and my own career
in a very, very positive way.
It's very evident on a day to day basis.

This is by far my favorite
job of my entire career
and my career spans roughly 25 years.
So, I plan to be here for a while.
(bright music)
